priorities.description: Maps PagerDuty incident priorities to Jira issue priorities for synchronization.

info.description:
This API enables the programatic management of the configuration rules that drive the PagerDuty's integration with Jira Cloud.

Before using the API you must setup the integration and connect at least one Jira Cloud account. Additional integration documentation can be found here: https://support.pagerduty.com/main/docs/jira-cloud.

### Account Mapping

An **Account Mapping** establishes a connection between a PagerDuty account and a Jira Cloud instance, enabling integration and synchronization between the two platforms.

One PagerDuty account may be connected to one or more Jira Cloud instances.

### Rule

A **Rule** (aka Configuration) defines the parameters for bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents. A Rule is always tied to an Account Mapping.
info.title: PagerDuty Jira Cloud Integration API

get.description:
List existing account mappings.

An Account Mapping establishes a connection between a PagerDuty account and a Jira Cloud instance, enabling integration and synchronization between the two platforms.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_accounts.read`

200.description: A paginated list of account mappings.

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

get.description:
Get detailed information about a specific account mapping.

An Account Mapping establishes a connection between a PagerDuty account and a Jira Cloud instance, enabling integration and synchronization between the two platforms.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_accounts.read`

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

get.description:
List existing rules for a specific account mapping.

A Rule configures the bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.read`

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

post.description:
Create a new rule.

A Rule configures the bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.write`

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

delete.description:
Delete an existing rule.

Once a rule is deleted, the synchronization between PagerDuty Incidents and Jira Issues linked by the rule stops.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.write`

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

get.description:
Get detailed information about an existing rule.

A Rule configures the bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.read`

401.description: Caller did not supply credentials or did not provide the correct credentials.

403.description:
Caller is not authorized to manage the requested resource. While the authentication is valid,
the authenticated user or token does not have permission to perform this action.

429.description: Too many requests have been made, the rate limit has been reached.

put.description:

A Rule configures the bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.
